Posts.Content: meg27 wrote: Hello, all!  I'm a 27 yo female who went in for an ultrasound last week after my PCP found a lump on my breast at my annual exam.  Assuming it was a cyst, she sent me to the Women's Center at our local hospital to check it out.  I've been through this 2 years ago, when she found a lump. Following both an ultrasound and a mammogram, the radiologist back then said "Don't come back until you're 40" which was great news!  However, the lump has not gone away, and here we go again.  This time, I had an ultrasound--- the tech only saw normal breast tissue.  The radiologist then wanted to do a mammogram since the lump was palpable but not visible on the ultrasound.  The mammogram came back "abnormal".  The radiologist took me to a private room, her arm around me as she walked me there.  I had a weird feeling this time-- The doctor told me that she is seeing a mass that appears to be very dense breast tissue and she just can't pinpoint what it is on the US or Mammo.. She told me she was sending me for an MRI to take a look at what's inside of the tissue.  She then immediately jumped to the question: "Do you know of a good breast surgeon?"  Of course, I did not.  She provided me with a list of surgeons.  She never once mentioned cancer or biopsy.  She appeared to be emotionally involved, as I assume I was her youngest patient that day.  I don't know what to think.  I'm prepared to hear bad news, but I also can't believe I feel so in the dark about this.  My MRI is tomorrow.  I have a follow up appt. with a well-respected breast imaging clinic on Friday where they can do a biopsy if needed AND provide a second opinion since I will be bringing all my test results with me on a CD.  Any thoughts on this?  Thanks for your help/advice! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Breast MRI meg27 meg27

Posts.Content: Nov 1, 2010 09:15PM meg27 wrote: Thanks Deanna, for your response.  I am still puzzled by the radiologist's reaction to the inconclusive findings.  She looked worried to me, but it's her professional obligation to tell me if she thinks it might be malignant, and she did not.  That does not decrease the amount of worry I've been experiencing in the least...  I did call my insurance company and they did approve the MRI with 100% coverage.  Thank goodness b/c I'm aware that it is a costly diagnostic test.  I will let you know what they come up with tomorrow.   Again, thank you!
Posts.Title: Breast MRI meg27 meg27

Posts.Content: Nov 1, 2010 08:22PM meg27 wrote: Thank you, Leaf, for your helpful information!  I forgot to mention that the radiologist did say due to my "hormone levels and age" that she was sure spots would "light up" on the MRI and that I shouldn't be surprised when they send me BACK to get another US...  I'm assuming this is due to the false-positives with MRI?  Or is she telling me she definitely sees the mass and knows it's going to be found on the MRI and that standard procedure would be the follow up US prior to biopsy?  Thanks for your thoughts.  :-)
